Description: Body sherd of Chian black-figured Grand Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of female figure (only drapery from chiton with added red remaining); at right, part of possible tail.
Curator's comments: D. Williams argued that this sherd belongs with British Museum 1924,1201.204 and British Museum 1924,1201.206 and possibly also with rim sherd British Museum 1888,0601.550a. Williams also suggests that this vase is a product of the Sirens Painter. Lemos identifies this sherd as a Black Figure komast chalice.
On the inside, in pencil '938 (f)' and a deleted A number.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 325, no. 1490)
Williams 2006a / The Chian Pottery from Naukratis (p. 130, p. fig. 19)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0869) (phase 2)
